abstract: Vivien Schweitzer reviews concert presented by Chamber Music Society of Lincoln Center, part of center's Summer Evenings series, at Alice Tully Hall.
lead_paragraph: The opening performance of the inaugural program, Summer Evenings, at Alice Tully Hall was a drama-free slate of genial, lyrical pieces by Mozart, Beethoven and Schubert.

headline.main: Review: Chamber Music Society of Lincoln Center Kicks Off a Summer Series
headline.print_headline: A Sunny Program for a Seasonal Series

snippet: The opening performance of the inaugural program, Summer Evenings, at Alice Tully Hall was a drama-free slate of genial, lyrical pieces by Mozart, Beethoven and Schubert.
